item.title: How do you find out the current runescape number?
item.dc:creator: @defyboy defyboy
item.description:
@defyboy wrote:

Heres an old script I wrote while figuring out the updateserver protocol for my new engine private server:

import java.net.*;
import java.io.*;

public class VersionCheck {

	public static String 	rAdr = "au1.runescape.com";		// Remote Server
	public static int 	rPrt = 43594;					// Remote Port
	public static int	sVer = 420;							// Initial Client Version

	public static void main(java.lang.String args[]){
		System.out.println("Current Version [ SpuneRace Project ]");
		System.out.println("Version 1.0 (C)2006 Troy Osborne [ defyboy@gmail.com ]");
		System.out.println("----------------------");
		VersionCheck v = new VersionCheck();
		v.connect();
	}
	
	public void connect(){
		try{
			System.out.println("Connecting to server [ " + rAdr + ":" + rPrt + " ]...");
			while(sVer < 500){
				skt = new Socket(rAdr, rPrt);
				ssi = skt.getInputStream();
				sso = skt.getOutputStream();
				System.out.print("Checking Version: " + sVer);
				sso.write(15);
				sso.write(0);
				sso.write(0);
				sso.write(sVer >> 8);
				sso.write(sVer);
				sso.flush();
				int r = ssi.read();	// Response (0=OK, 6=Out of date)
				if(r == 0){
					System.out.println(" OK, Version found: " + sVer);
					System.out.println("----------------------");
					System.exit(0);
				}else{
					System.out.println(" Failed...");
					sVer++;
					sso.close();
					ssi.close();
					skt.close();
				}
			}
			System.out.println("----------------------");
			System.out.println("Couldnt find version.");
		}catch(Exception _ex){
			System.out.println("Failed!");
			System.out.println("An error occurred connecting to server, Check your settings.");
			System.exit(2);
		}
	}

	public Socket skt;
	public InputStream ssi;
	public OutputStream sso;
	
}

Read full topic

item.title: How do you find out the current runescape number?
item.dc:creator: @NOURLOL NOURLOL
item.description:
@NOURLOL wrote:

Not really, it’s not that changed, just moved around. I managed to resurrect a lot of Aryan’s old functions such as tileToMinimap,

[code] public int getCameraRotation() {
try {
return getPrimitive(“cameraRot”).getInt(null);
}
catch(Exception e) {
e.printStackTrace();
return -1;
}
}

public int getCameraRotationOffset() {
    try {
        return getPrimitive("cameraRotOffset").getInt(null);
    }
    catch(Exception e) {
        e.printStackTrace();
        return -1;
    }
}

public int getMinimapInt3() {
    try {
        return getPrimitive("minimapInt3").getInt(null);
    }
    catch(Exception e) {
        e.printStackTrace();
        return -1;
    }
}

public int[] getModelIntArray1() {
    try {
        return (int[]) getObject("modelIntArray1");
    }
    catch(Exception e) {
        e.printStackTrace();
        return null;
    }
}

public int[] getModelIntArray2() {
    try {
        return (int[]) getObject("modelIntArray2");
    }
    catch(Exception e) {
        e.printStackTrace();
        return null;
    }
}


public int[] tileToMinimap(int[] tile) {
    int[] base = getBaseCoords();
    tile[0] -= base[0];
    tile[1] -= base[1];
    int[] rawPos = getRawPlayerPosition();
    int i = (tile[0] * 4 + 2) - rawPos[0] / 32;
    int j = (tile[1] * 4 + 2) - rawPos[1] / 32;
    int k = getCameraRotation() + getCameraRotationOffset() & 0x7ff;
    int l = j * j + i * i;
    if (l > 6400)
            return null;
    int i1 = getModelIntArray1()[k];
    int j1 =  getModelIntArray2()[k];
    i1 = (i1 * 256) / (getMinimapInt3() + 256);
    j1 = (j1 * 256) / (getMinimapInt3() + 256);
    int k1 = j * i1 + i * j1 >> 16;
    int l1 = j * j1 - i * i1 >> 16;

    int screenx = 550 + ((94 + k1) + 4);
    int screeny = 4 + (83 - l1 - 4);
    return new int[] { screenx, screeny };
}

[/code]All of the old data and variables even are there, they’re just around in different classes.

Read full topic

I wanted to try it, cause I never did.[/quote]The problem isn’t a matter of deobfuscation, the old client Aryan used deobfuscated less than it does now. The problem is now:

[ul][li]We can’t rename safely[/li]
[li]A lot of garbage makes matching patterns near impossible[/li][/ul]
